intro: Erica sexfaria, commonly known as the Cape heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. This evergreen shrub typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in spring. Erica sexfaria is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal and Mediterranean climates.
